channel.title: Object Manager (Floors)
channel.description: I want to add something to the second floor. How do i do that? c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(**, ****, ****, 0, 10);

item.title: Object Manager (Floors)
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=650821.msg4367565#msg4367565 date=1379972719]
Rofl, you guys…

c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(ObjectID, ObjectX, ObjectY, ObjectRotation, ObjectType);

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:4, topic:532029”]if (c.getPA().heightLevel == 1) { c.getPA().object(o.objectId, o.objectX, o.objectY, o.face, o.type); }[/quote]
Yeah I was looking for this documentation for the entire 20 minutes (I don’t have a single PI server downloaded and didn’t want to change that).

Read full topic

item.title: Object Manager (Floors)
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Rofl, you guys…

c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(ObjectID, ObjectX, ObjectY, ObjectRotation, ObjectType);

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:4, topic:532029”]if (c.getPA().heightLevel == 1) { c.getPA().object(o.objectId, o.objectX, o.objectY, o.face, o.type); }
Best answer I could find after about 20 minutes of scavenging
Seems as though PI didn’t handle this packet correctly so you have to work around that[/quote]

This is about the best you can do here^

Read full topic

item.title: Object Manager (Floors)
item.dc:creator: @jan_julius jan julius
item.description:
@jan_julius wrote:

You realize that coding consists out of keep on testing till you get the right thing, in this case you do not know what the variables consist of, therefor you could have atleast tried to change it.

Now for the thing you wanted to know, it’s always xyz

so, to get your object on the 2nd layer for example.

xcoord, ycoord, zcoord.

zcoord = 2 and you’ll be set.

Read full topic

item.title: Object Manager (Floors)
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

if (c.getPA().heightLevel == 1) { c.getPA().object(o.objectId, o.objectX, o.objectY, o.face, o.type); }
Best answer I could find after about 20 minutes of scavenging
Seems as though PI didn’t handle this packet correctly so you have to work around that

Read full topic

item.title: Object Manager (Floors)
item.dc:creator: @Doing_Cho21 Doing Cho2
item.description:
@Doing_Cho21 wrote:

eyeownyew:

Change the 0 to 1 iirc

That only changes the way the object faces, I.E North-East-South-West.
(I have tried that)
